plugins.name: Batch Description Update
plugins.description:
Adding a description to your Figma's components brings some benefits. When it comes to icons, adding terms and tags can help users find icons in the asset panel. However, maintaining component descriptions can be a lot of work, especially for a long set of icons. This plugin allows users to update all component descriptions with three clicks.

  • Create a .CSV file where the first column is the component name and the second is the desired description;
  • Run the plugin 'Batch Description Update', select the .CSV file, and run the process;
  • Done! Your components have their descriptions updated in no time.
plugins.tagline: Update component description in batch through a .CSV file

plugins.name: Color Analyzer
plugins.description:
Color Analyzer is an intuitive Figma plugin that provides in-depth analysis of colors in your designs. Once you select an element, the plugin generates a square representing the analyzed color alongside comprehensive information:


Displays color values in HEX, RGB, and CMYK formats

Automatically calculates and shows contrast ratios against white (#FFF) and black (#000) backgrounds

Presents results in a clear, easy-to-read format next to the analyzed element


With Color Analyzer, you can quickly check WCAG accessibility compliance, optimize text readability, and ensure color consistency across your designs. Perfect for UI/UX designers who care about details and accessibility in their interfaces.
plugins.tagline: Detailed color analysis with HEX, RGB, CMYK values and contrast ratios for accessibility.

plugins.name: Contrast checker
plugins.description:
Contrast Checker is a Figma plugin designed to help designers ensure their designs are accessible by automatically analyzing text and background color contrast within selected frames. The plugin checks for compliance with accessibility standards, highlights potential issues, and provides detailed reports, enabling you to create inclusive and user-friendly designs effortlessly.



What the Plugin Does


‚Ä¢Automatic Contrast Analysis: The plugin scans selected frames to identify text elements and their background colors, calculating the contrast ratio between them.

‚Ä¢Accessibility Compliance: It checks whether the contrast ratios meet the WCAG (Web Content Accessibility Guidelines) standards, specifically for normal and large text.

‚Ä¢Detailed Reports: After analysis, the plugin generates a comprehensive report that highlights any text elements that do not meet the required contrast ratios, providing actionable feedback.

‚Ä¢Issue Highlighting: Users can locate specific elements with contrast issues directly within their design by using the ‚ÄúLocate‚Äù feature.

‚Ä¢Ignore Option: If certain elements are intentionally designed with lower contrast, users can choose to ignore those specific issues.



How to Use the Plugin


1.Select a Frame: Start by selecting the frame or frames within your Figma document that you want to analyze.

2.Run the Plugin: Launch the Contrast Checker plugin. It will automatically start analyzing the selected frame(s).

3.View the Report: Once the analysis is complete, view the detailed report generated by the plugin. This report will list all the text elements within the frame(s) and indicate whether they meet the required contrast ratio.

4.Address Issues: Use the ‚ÄúLocate‚Äù button to find and fix elements with contrast issues in your design.

5.Manage Issues: Optionally, ignore any issues that you don‚Äôt need to fix by using the ‚ÄúIgnore‚Äù feature.



Limitations


‚Ä¢Text Detection: The plugin only analyzes visible text elements and solid background colors. It may not correctly analyze text with gradient backgrounds, images, or complex overlays.

‚Ä¢Performance: The plugin performs best on smaller frames or a limited number of selected frames at once. Analyzing very large frames with numerous text elements may take longer.

‚Ä¢Customization: Currently, the plugin does not support custom contrast thresholds beyond the WCAG standards, and it does not provide options for customizing the analysis parameters.


By using the Contrast Checker, designers can ensure their work is accessible, improving the overall inclusivity of their designs.
plugins.tagline: boost accessibility w/ seamless contrast checks ‚Äî ensure every design is inclusive & user-friendly!

plugins.name: List Texts, Select Text
plugins.description:
Keep your text layer names tidy and unique.


Easily list all of the text elements on the current page by their Frame and Element name. Click on the name to select that text element to edit it.


Getting Started:

  1. The plugin will automatically display the current page you are on and list all text elements on that page
  2. The list format is [Closest Parent Frame Name]::[Text Element Name]
  3. Click on an item in the list to easily select that item
  4. This plugin will also display a "DUPE" warning for elements that have the same name


This plugin was built to help maintain unique key names for Lokalise exports.


Free

This plugin is free!
plugins.tagline: Keep your text layer names tidy and unique. List all layers then select with this tool.

plugins.name: Figiconizer - Auto-Resizes & Organizer Icons
plugins.description:
Figiconizer ‚Äì Simplify Icon Organization in Figma!

Figiconizer is a handy plugin designed to help you quickly and efficiently organize icons in Figma. Whether you're working with individual icons or creating an entire icon set, Figiconizer automatically arranges your icons and resizes them to fit your desired dimensions.


How Does It Work?

  1. Select your icons in Figma.
  2. Run the Figiconizer plugin.
  3. Enter your preferred frame size and padding value.
  4. Figiconizer automatically arranges your icons proportionally within the frames.


Why Choose Figiconizer?

  1. Fast and Efficient: No more manually resizing icons one by one. Create a perfectly organized icon set in seconds.
  2. Customizable Settings: Set your own frame size and padding values to ensure your icons look exactly the way you want.
  3. Tidy Workspace: Keep your icons neatly organized, speeding up your design workflow.


Who Is It For?

  1. Designers creating icon sets.
  2. Anyone who wants a clean and consistent workspace in Figma.
  3. UX/UI designers looking to speed up their prototyping process.


With Figiconizer, organizing icons has never been easier! Try it now and save time on your Figma projects. üçªüéâ

plugins.name: ZapCode
plugins.description:
Ever dreamed of turning your Figma designs into glorious, ultra-responsive code with just a couple of clicks? Well, dream no more, friend‚Äîthis plugin is your magic wand!


Here‚Äôs the game plan:


  1. Select your Figma layer: Want the entire page? Click it. Only need a nifty component? Select it.
  2. Press the ‚ÄúZap-it‚Äù Button: Sit back, sip your coffee, and let our AI do its super-brainy thing.
  3. Download your freshly minted code: HTML, CSS, Angular, and more! Plus, assets are included.
  4. Name your components: Enter your preferred component names, and we‚Äôll use them to create files tailored to your needs.
  5. Success! You just dodged hours of hand-coding. Cue confetti!


New Features You‚Äôll Love:


Angular Tech Stack: Now supporting Angular with advanced settings to fit your specific needs.


Tailwind & Bootstrap Support: For HTML/CSS conversion, you can now choose between Tailwind and Bootstrap frameworks.


Custom Component Naming: Add a personal touch to your files by naming components as per your preference.


Oh, and don‚Äôt forget:


  1. Every day, you‚Äôll get 5 free Zapcoins for your code generation adventures. Need more? You can now buy Zapcoins directly within the plugin via Buy Me a Coffee.
  2. Redeem Zapcoins with tokens sent to your email and unlock premium features.
  3. First, click the ‚ÄúAPI Key‚Äù button to feed our AI (we use Anthropic‚Äôs API)‚Äîyour key is stored securely in Figma's storage. Converted files are also saved there for safekeeping. No shady external servers, promise!
  4. No need to enter API key while using free Zapcoins, Gemini will be used to convert your designs.


Now go forth, fearless designer, and code all the things‚Ä¶without actually writing code. Because that‚Äôs how we roll! üöÄ
plugins.tagline: Go Design To Code with One Click.

plugins.name: Reablocks Figma Plugin
plugins.description:
Reablocks Figma Plugin

Plugin utilities to supercharge your dev work for reablocks (an open-source repo containing a set of enterprise UI components for React).


Features

CSS Token Generator: Generate Reablock-compatible JSON from Figma Style variables


CSS Token Generator Usage


Pre-requisite

You should have style created for all colors that you want to use in the project

You should use the following naming convention to assign style property to your colors

E.g.: 'Primary', 'Brand', 'Primary/100', 'Brand/title black 100'``


# Running Plugin

- Go to the Figma design file where you want to use the plugin

- Use `CMD + p` to open quick menu

- Search for new plugins using "Find More plugins option" and search for "Reablocks Figma Plugin"

- Once found, click on run plugin, it will open a popup

- Click on "Generate CSS"

- Click on "Copy CSS"

- Use the copied CSS tokens to your project


Development guide

Check the readme file @ https://github.com/reaviz/reablocks-figma-plugin/blob/main/README.md for dev contribution guidelines
plugins.tagline: Your Figma companion for Reablock

plugins.name: Timesaver: Conditionally Select, Rename, Export, Delete, Duplicate
plugins.description:
The plugin code is open-sourced on Github https://github.com/fireinureeyes/figma-timesaver-plugin


Stop doing things one by one and save time instead

Define your custom conditions and quickly filter out any subset of elements across your file.

Then choose one of the actions to bulk process them.


Example use cases

SELECT all groups not using auto layout,

RENAME all frames on the bottom half of the screen (regex allowed),

EXPORT all icons of a specific layer name format,

DELETE all masks or locked elements,

DUPLICATE and collect all components on one page,

or EXPORT A LIST of elements as a CSV file for documentation purposes.

The possibilities are endless...


Freely combine more than 80 properties to get what you need

Use logical AND and OR to build up complex conditions from:

Scope:

  1. Current page
  2. Whole document
  3. Existing selection


Object type:

  1. Components
  2. Instances
  3. Texts
  4. Shapes (rectangles, stars, lines, polygons...)
  5. Sections
  6. Vectors
  7. Groups
  8. Frames
  9. Boolean operations (unions, substracts, intersects, excludes)


General object properties:

  1. Layer name
  2. Page name
  3. Width
  4. Height
  5. X-Coordinate
  6. Y-Coordinate
  7. Visibility
  8. Rotation
  9. Number of children
  10. Nested level
  11. Number of points (paths)
  12. Locked state
  13. Mask state
  14. Export setting
  15. Overridden properties


Appearance:

  1. Rounding
  2. Fill
  3. Stroke
  4. Stroke color
  5. Opacity
  6. Blendmode
  7. Fill blendmode
  8. Fill opacity
  9. Fill visibility
  10. Stroke opacity
  11. Stroke blendmode
  12. Stroke visiblity
  13. Stroke type
  14. Stroke alignment


Effects:

  1. Drop shadow active
  2. Drop shadow x-offset
  3. Drop shadow y-offset
  4. Drop shadow blur
  5. Drop shadow spread
  6. Drop shadow color
  7. Drop shadow blendmode
  8. Inner shadow active
  9. Inner shadow x-offset
  10. Inner shadow y-offset
  11. Inner shadow blur
  12. Inner shadow spread
  13. Inner shadow color
  14. Inner shadow blendmode
  15. Layer blur active
  16. Background blur active


Text:

  1. Font name
  2. Font size
  3. Line height
  4. Letter spacing
  5. Font weight
  6. Horizontal alignment type
  7. Vertical alignment type
  8. Text decoration underline
  9. Text decoration strikethrough
  10. Paragraph indentation
  11. Paragraph spacing


Auto layout:

  1. Auto layout active
  2. Position
  3. Direction
  4. Item spacing
  5. Padding top
  6. Padding bottom
  7. Padding left
  8. Padding Right


Interaction:

  1. Interaction active
  2. Interaction trigger
  3. Interaction action
  4. Flow starting point


Or narrow down your selection manually from the results list. Clicking on the results will locate the elements on the canvas, so you can easily see what is being adjusted before executing the action.


Renaming supports the following variables:

  1. {id} - unique number
  2. {name} - original layer name
  3. {page} - name of the page where the layer is located
  4. {date} - current date in a YYYY-MM-DD format
  5. {alphabet} - letter sequence a-z
plugins.tagline: Define your custom conditions and quickly filter out any subset of elements across your file.

plugins.name: Moospire
plugins.description:
Description for Moospire Figma Plugin;

Moospire‚Äôs Figma plugin is designed to revolutionize how you create and curate moodboards. Whether you're sourcing inspiration from the web or harnessing the power of AI to bring your unique visions to life, this plugin is ideal for designers seeking an efficient way to visualize and consolidate design concepts directly within your Figma projects.


What to Expect from the Moospire Figma Plugin

1. Seamless Web Curation:

This feature allows you to explore and curate moodboards by compiling the most inspiring and relevant content found across the web. Whether you're looking for design trends, color schemes, or visual ideas, Moospire makes it easy to gather these elements directly into your Figma workspace.


2. AI-Powered Creation:

Transform your thoughts into beautifully cohesive moodboards with just a few clicks. Submit your concepts via text, images, sketches, or even voice notes, and watch as Moospire‚Äôs AI effortlessly crafts these inputs into structured moodboards. This feature is particularly beneficial for capturing the essence of spontaneous ideas and turning them into actionable designs.


How to Use the Moospire Figma Plugin

Installation: Begin by installing the Moospire plugin from the Figma plugin store.

Launching Moospire: Access Moospire directly within your Figma project by navigating to the plugin section and selecting Moospire.

Searching and Curating: Use the search feature to find web content or let Moospire suggest materials based on search & past preferences.

Creating with AI: Upload your creative inputs through the plugin‚Äôs interface, and specify the type of moodboard content you need. The AI will process your inputs and generate a moodboard ideas right within your Figma canvas.
plugins.tagline: The Spark you need to create

- Project Nomenclature: Enter your project's code or abbreviation

3. Click "Generate" and you're done! Your selected frames will have new unique names


Perfect for:

- Maintaining consistent nomenclature in large projects

- Facilitating collaboration in design teams

- Improving organization and workflow in Figma


Streamline your workflow and keep your Figma files organized with Frame ID Generator.

plugins.description:

  3. Indicator position is inconsistent with drag position and zoom level
  4. Some frames or images fail to load properly


This plugin is opensource and can be found here:

https://github.com/uxmauro/figma-plugin-aerial

Fake Data Maker let's you quickly filter through 50+ different types of data (e.g. full names, email addresses, credit cards, emojis, addresses, etc) so you can use this data in your designs to test how it'll look in the real-world.

  2. All the Fake Data text is free of any copyright or trademarks


‚ãî Filter from the 50+ categories:

  1. Browse through all 50+ categories (with 10 sample values for each; 500+ total)
  2. Filter by category types (e.g. "Only show me email addresses and credit cards")


üìã 1-click "copy to clipboard":

  1. Click on any button to copy the text to your clipboard

plugins.name: Variable Find & Replace Across Libraries
plugins.description:
Are you tired of manually updating variables one by one across your Figma files? This plugin is the powerful solution you've been waiting for, saving design teams hundreds of hours of tedious work.


‚ú® Key Features

  1. One-Click Variable Replacement ‚Äî Replace any variable throughout your entire page instantly
  2. Comprehensive Variable Support ‚Äî Works with dimensions, strokes, fills, shadows, fonts, and more
  3. Style Integration ‚Äî Even replace the variable in styles that use your target variables, ensuring complete system consistency
  4. Multiple Library Sources ‚Äî Select variables from both local and team shared libraries
  5. Lightning-Fast Performance ‚Äî Process thousands of elements in seconds
  6. Design System Friendly ‚Äî Perfect for design system refactoring and maintenance


üîÑ How It Works

  1. Select the variable you want to replace
  2. Click "Find" to target all its occurrences on page
  3. Choose a new variable from your local or team library
  4. Click "Replace" and watch the magic happen
  5. That's it! All instances are updated instantly


Don't let variable replacement slow down your design workflow. Install now and transform how you work with Figma variables!

plugins.name: DesignDetox
plugins.description:
Transform your Figma experience with DesignDetox ‚Äì the ultimate tool for decluttering and optimizing your design workspace. Our plugin is engineered to enhance the efficiency of designers by providing a swift and seamless way to manage and organize your Figma files.


Key Features:

  • Detach Instances and Components: Simplify your designs by detaching all instances and components with just a click. Perfect for finalizing designs or preparing files for handoff.
  • Remove Auto-Layouts: Instantly strip away auto-layout properties from selected frames, allowing for more flexible manipulation and customization of your designs.
  • Eliminate Hidden Layers: Clean up your workspace by removing all hidden layers from the entire page. A great way to reduce file size and improve manageability.


DesignDetox is more than just a plugin; it's your personal assistant for maintaining a clean and efficient design environment. With its intuitive interface and powerful features, DesignDetox is an indispensable tool for every Figma user looking to enhance productivity and focus on creativity.


Easy to Use:

  • Simple, user-friendly interface with clear, actionable buttons.
  • Real-time updates on the count of instances/components, auto-layout frames, and hidden layers in your project.
  • Instant notifications provide feedback on actions taken for transparency and control.


Whether you're a seasoned designer or just starting out, DesignDetox helps you maintain a clutter-free workspace, enabling you to focus on what truly matters ‚Äì creating stunning designs. Try DesignDetox today and experience a cleaner, more efficient design process in Figma!

plugins.name: Place inside!
plugins.description:
How many times have you realised that the objects you are working on are not inside the art board? How many times have you missed some elements in the art board while exporting or playing prototype?


This plugin is the solution to all these issues. It will check if there are any objects staying outside of frames and nest them inside if they are directly above the frame. The position of the object remains intact.
plugins.tagline: Nest objects lying outside of artboards inside. No more floating layers!

plugins.name: Color Control
plugins.description:
Color Control simplifies color adjustments by visualizing the HSL (Hue, Saturation, Lightness, and Alpha) color model and providing precise control over color properties.


Simply select an object, modify its fill or stroke using the HSL sliders, and see your changes applied instantly.
plugins.tagline: A more intuitive way to refine colors

plugins.name: Layer Duplicator Pro
plugins.description:
Layer Duplicator Pro


Layer Duplicator Pro is an innovative plugin for Figma designed to streamline the process of duplicating and modifying design layers using data from Excel spreadsheets. Whether you're managing complex design projects or iterating on prototypes, this tool enhances efficiency and accuracy by integrating structured data seamlessly into your Figma workspace.


Main Features:

  1. Effortless Integration: Import data directly from Excel into Figma to duplicate layers and apply modifications swiftly.
  2. Structured Data Handling: Manage detailed information about design layers through Excel, ensuring precise replication and edits.
  3. Visual Representation: Review and validate changes clearly within Figma, enhancing collaboration and decision-making.
  4. Enhanced Workflow: Optimize design iterations by leveraging Excel's organizational capabilities directly within Figma.


How to Use:

  1. Download Data: Extract specific details from layers into an Excel file. First, select the layer you wish to duplicate. An Excel file with the necessary structure will be automatically generated and downloaded.
  2. Import and Duplicate: Once the automatically generated Excel file has been downloaded, generate rows corresponding to each element that will be duplicated based on the selected layer. You can modify these elements by editing the corresponding columns in the Excel file. Layer Duplicator Pro will automatically adjust the indicated parameters and create a duplicated layer with the desired dimensions.
  3. Review Results: Efficiently validate changes and errors through intuitive visual feedback within Figma.


Benefits:

  1. Increased Productivity: Simplify complex design tasks and accelerate project timelines.
  2. Improved Collaboration: Foster better teamwork by visualizing changes and updates clearly.
  3. Streamlined Processes: Eliminate manual duplication efforts and streamline iterative design workflows.


Next Steps:

Explore how Layer Duplicator Pro can revolutionize your design process by integrating structured data seamlessly from Excel into Figma. Enhance productivity and creativity with a tool designed to simplify and elevate your design workflow.
plugins.tagline: Duplicate, resize, edit text & images swiftly in Figma for streamlined design workflows.
